nodes.label: Traditional PAR (400-700 nm)
nodes.description: Photosynthetically active radiation traditionally defined as wavelengths from 400 to 700 nanometers, excluding far-red photons which this study shows significantly underestimates photosynthetic capacity

nodes.label: Far-red photons (701-750 nm)
nodes.description: Photons in the 701-750 nm wavelength range that contribute significantly to photosynthesis, especially in shaded environments where they can constitute over 50% of incident photons

nodes.label: PSI preferential excitation
nodes.description: Longer-wavelength far-red photons preferentially excite Photosystem I, complementing PSII excitation by shorter wavelengths and leading to increased photosynthetic efficiency through balanced excitation

nodes.label: PSII efficiency enhancement
nodes.description: Enhancement of Photosystem II efficiency through synergistic interactions between far-red and shorter-wavelength photons, demonstrated in controlled experimental settings

nodes.label: Sunlit photosynthesis contribution (24-25%)
nodes.description: Far-red photons account for approximately 24-25% of leaf gross photosynthesis under full sun conditions, representing a substantial contribution to total photosynthetic output

nodes.label: Shade photosynthesis contribution (10-14%)
nodes.description: Far-red photons contribute 10-14% of leaf gross photosynthesis in deep shade conditions, despite their high relative abundance in shaded environments

nodes.label: Shaded environments
nodes.description: Environmental conditions where far-red photons can constitute over 50% of incident photons and are utilized efficiently for photosynthesis, particularly important for understory vegetation

nodes.label: Wavelength synergistic interactions
nodes.description: Synergistic interactions between far-red photons and shorter-wavelength photons that significantly enhance photosynthesis beyond what would be expected from individual wavelength contributions

nodes.label: Filter removal experiments
nodes.description: Experimental methodology using filters to remove photons above 700 nm to demonstrate the significant contribution of far-red photons to photosynthetic processes

nodes.label: Leaf gross photosynthesis
nodes.description: Overall photosynthetic carbon fixation at the leaf level, measured to quantify the specific contributions of far-red photons under different light conditions

nodes.label: Canopy environments
nodes.description: Forest canopy conditions where current models excluding photons >700 nm may significantly underestimate actual photosynthetic rates due to high far-red photon availability

nodes.label: Photosynthesis measurement models
nodes.description: Current photosynthetic models and measurement techniques that exclude photons >700 nm and may underestimate actual photosynthesis, particularly in canopy and shade environments

nodes.label: Plant productivity assessment
nodes.description: Measurement and understanding of plant productivity that requires inclusion of far-red photon contributions for accurate assessment at various ecological scales

nodes.label: Global carbon cycle
nodes.description: Global carbon cycling processes that may be better understood by incorporating far-red photon contributions to photosynthesis, affecting climate change impact assessments

nodes.label: Ecosystem dynamics modeling
nodes.description: Ecosystem-scale dynamic modeling that should incorporate far-red photons to better understand plant productivity and ecosystem functioning under natural light conditions

nodes.label: Crop improvement applications
nodes.description: Agricultural applications for crop improvement that could benefit from understanding and utilizing far-red photon contributions to enhance crop photosynthetic efficiency

nodes.label: Natural light conditions
nodes.description: Real-world natural light conditions where far-red photons play a significant role in photosynthesis, contrasting with controlled laboratory conditions that may exclude these wavelengths

nodes.label: PAR definition revision
nodes.description: Proposed revision of the photosynthetically active radiation definition to include far-red wavelengths (701-750 nm) for more accurate photosynthetic measurements and modeling
